Yesterday marked the 55th anniversary of the signing of the Voting Rights Act. The law established nationwide voting rights protections, specifically by prohibiting racial discrimination in determining a person's eligibility to vote. In 2013, the VRA was weakened significantly after the Shelby County v. Holder Supreme Court case limited the Federal government's ability to oversee changes in states' voting regulations. The decision left an opening for several states to implement a variety of rules that amount to voter suppression. To honor the countless changemakers who sacrificed their safety and even their lives in order to expand access to the ballot, please make sure that you register to vote and have a voting plan!
#DPPSCivics #vote #gotv

We honor the powerful figures whose deeds still impact us today, such as the Grenadian-descended human rights activist Malcolm X, Jamaican musician Bob Marley, Antiguan-American author Jamaica Kincaid, and many more!

Local businesswoman Monica Price, owner of Meticulous Hair in San Antonio, Texas, made sure our scholars looked camera-ready for their first day of school.

Monica Price enlisted the help of local barbers to style and cut 20 scholars...free of charge! During our Back to School Bash, we raffled off haircuts to our families. Families and scholars were thrilled to participate and to receive their fresh 'dos!'"

Thank you, Meticulous Hair!

These scholars, all members of the Korean club, were visiting to learn about Korea's 100th anniversary of the March 1st independence movement.
